meanings.definition: To refuse to buy, use, or participate in something as a way of protesting or expressing disapproval.
meanings.sent1: She was boycotting the store because of their unfair practices.
meanings.sent2: Many people were boycotting the company to show their dissatisfaction.
meanings.sent3: The group decided to boycott the cafeteria until they improved the food quality.
meanings.sent4: By boycotting the event, they made a strong statement against injustice.
meanings.sent5: His decision to boycott the movie premiere was a powerful form of protest.

meanings.definition: The act of boycotting, typically as a form of protest or social action.
meanings.sent1: The boycott of the product led to a decrease in sales.
meanings.sent2: She organized a boycott of the company to demand change.
meanings.sent3: The boycott of the school cafeteria became a topic of discussion.
meanings.sent4: Their boycott of the event caught the attention of the media.
meanings.sent5: The success of the boycott showed the impact of collective action.
